## ServiceError class

An error representing a query failure returned by Fauna.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class ServiceError extends Error
```

<b>Extends:</b> Error

## Constructors

| Constructor                                                   | Modifiers | Description                                                      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [(constructor)(error)](./fauna.serviceerror._constructor_.md) |           | Constructs a new instance of the <code>ServiceError</code> class |

## Properties

| Property                                         | Modifiers             | Type   | Description                                                                                                                                              |
| ------------------------------------------------ | --------------------- | ------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [code](./fauna.serviceerror.code.md)             | <code>readonly</code> | string | A code for the error. Codes indicate the cause of the error. It is safe to write programmatic logic against the code. They are part of the API contract. |
| [httpStatus](./fauna.serviceerror.httpstatus.md) | <code>readonly</code> | number | The HTTP Status Code of the error.                                                                                                                       |
| [summary?](./fauna.serviceerror.summary.md)      | <code>readonly</code> | string | <i>(Optional)</i> A summary of the error in a human readable form. Only present where message does not suffice.                                          |
